intro: Teline pallida subsp. silensis, commonly known as Silene silensis, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Teline pallida subsp. silensis is often found in disturbed or marginal areas, showing some adaptability to different environmental conditions.
